reasoning: Schizophrenia has well-documented incidence (10-40 per 100k per year globally, ~15 new cases per 100k) and prevalence (~0.5-0.7% or 5000-7000 per 100k). Reported both metrics; prevalence is more clinically relevant for chronic mental health conditions. Global estimate from WHO 2005 Mental Health Report.
source: WHO Mental Health Report 2005; Regier DA et al. (1993). One-month prevalence of mental disorders in the United States. Arch Gen Psychiatry. 50(2):85-94
